secondaryItems.caption: Old Mill House and deck structures from New Mill House, 1978. Fairmount Water Works was allowed to deteriorate. Exteriors were marred by graffiti and needed maintenance. The Cliffside Paths, overgrown and missing railings, were a safety hazard.

historicContext.text: In 1975 the American Society of Civil Engineers declared Fairmount Waterworks a National Historic Civil Engineering Landmark and on May 11, 1976, it was designated a National Historic Landmark by the U.S. Secretary of the Interior. In 1977 the American Society of Mechanical Engineers made the waterworks a National Historic Mechanical Engineering Landmark. Despite its multiple — award status, the facility continued to deteriorate and in 1984 was included in the report to Congress by the Secretary of the Interior on damaged and threatened national landmarks.
